ilog.cp

Class IloCustomIntValueChooser

  • java.lang.Object
    • ilog.cp.IloCustomIntValueChooser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IloIntValueChooser

    public abstract class IloCustomIntValueChooser
extends java.lang.Object
implements IloIntValueChooser
    This is the base class for custom IntValueChooser. You need to subclass this to implement your own IntValueChooser.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected IloCustomIntValueChooser(IloCP cp)
      This constructor is to used in the constructor of your subclass as follows: super(cp)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract int choose(IloCP cp, IloIntVar[] x, int index)
      This abstract method must be defined to choose a value for the variable x[index].
      void end()

      • IloCustomIntValueChooser

                            throws IloException
        This constructor is to used in the constructor of your subclass as follows: super(cp)
        Throws:
        IloException

    • Method Detail

      • choose

        public abstract int choose(IloCP cp,
         IloIntVar[] x,
         int index)
        This abstract method must be defined to choose a value for the variable x[index]. The variable x[index] has been selected from the array x at an earlier stage. The selected value must be returned by the method. The array x is given to such a method because some value selection strategies may need the full array of variables to perform a selection.

      • end

        public void end()
        Specified by:
        end in interface IloIntValueChooser
